name: Iron Ingot
description: A bar of iron, solid and heavy.

name: Key Mold
description: A mold for casting basic key shapes.

name: Clockwork Spring
description: A tightly wound spring used in mechanical devices.

name: Tiny Gear
description: A small cog, part of a mechanical system.

name: Keyring Loop
description: A ring-shaped holder often used to carry keys.

name: Leather Strip
description: A small strip of worn leather, surprisingly strong.

name: Forged Key Shaft
description: A rough metallic key body, shaped from a molten ingot using a mould.

name: Mechanical Core
description: An inner mechanism allowing the key to interact with complex or magical locks.

name: Carrying Grip
description: A grip or holding mechanism allowing one to carry or identify the key easily.

name: Assembled Key Frame
description: A nearly complete key, with body and grip, but lacking internal functionality.

name: Functional Door Key
description: The final key—mechanically complete, usable on advanced or enchanted locks.

name: Lucky Charm
description: A trinket that brings peace of mind to the emotional.

name: Small Notebook
description: Empty pages for thoughts or plans — could be useful to the logical.

name: Spare Glasses
description: An intellectual tool or a social vulnerability?

name: Old Photograph
description: A memory from the past — valuable to someone sentimental.

name: Wire Snipper
description: Could cut through something... or just be a bluff.

name: Broken Spoon
description: Utterly useless. Why are you carrying this?

name: Crumpled Paper
description: Whatever was written here is long gone.

name: Muddy Rock
description: A rock. It has mud. That’s all.

name: Empty Box
description: Nothing inside. Not even disappointment.
